title: Baked barbecue cod fillets with a crunchy Asian-inspired salad
summary: “Rice noodles, sweet and sticky cod, and crunchy veg in a zingy lime dressing, this speedy midweek dinner is full of fresh and vibrant flavours.” - chef Chris Baber
ingredients: 8 Plant Kitchen no chorizo posh puppies
1 jar Cook With M&S Cajun paste
recipe_steps: 1 Rinse the rice with cold water until it runs clear and set aside.
2 Add the olive oil to a large non-stick pan over a medium-high heat and fry the Plant Kitchen no chorizo posh puppies for 2-3 minutes until they begin to take on some colour.
3 Add all the chopped veg, season and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Then stir in the jar of Cook With M&S Cajun paste and cook for another minute.
4 Add the rice, and stir to ensure it is evenly coated in the paste before adding the boiling water.

5 Bring to the boil and then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover loosely and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is fulled absorbed, stirring occasionally. If the pan becomes too try, add a splash more water.
6 When the rice is cooked, fluff it up with a fork, scatter over the spring onions and parsley, and then squeeze over the lemon. Serve with the sweet baby leaf salad.

title: SAUCY SAUSAGES AND BEANS WITH MEGA-CREAMY MASH
summary: This hearty casserole is the ultimate winter warmer, and packs in loads of good-for-you stuff too - like cannellini beans, tomatoes and kale. - Chris Baber
ingredients: 8 Plant Kitchen no chorizo posh puppies
1 jar Cook With M&S Cajun paste
recipe_steps: 1 Heat a splash of oil in a casserole dish over a high heat, then brown the sausages, turning, until golden all over. Set aside on a plate.
2 Lower the heat to medium and add another splash of olive oil to the pan. Add the fennel seeds and rosemary and let them sizzle for a couple of minutes.
3 Add all the chopped veg, season and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Then stir in the jar of Cook With M&S Cajun paste and cook for another minute.
4 Add the rice, and stir to ensure it is evenly coated in the paste before adding the boiling water.

5 Bring to the boil and then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover loosely and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is fulled absorbed, stirring occasionally. If the pan becomes too try, add a splash more water.
6 When the rice is cooked, fluff it up with a fork, scatter over the spring onions and parsley, and then squeeze over the lemon. Serve with the sweet baby leaf salad.

title: SUPER SALMON TRAYBAKE
summary: With vibrant veggies and responsible sourced Scottish salmon fillets that are high in omega 4, this Cajun salmon traybake is fuss free to prepare and tastes amazing - Chris Baber
ingredients: 1 pack Cook With M&S Cajun seasoning
recipe_steps: 1 Preheat the oven to 200°C/ 180°C fan/ gas mark 6

2 Add all the veg and chopped tomatoes to a roasting tin, season with salt and pepper, and then scatter over half the Cook With M&S Cajun seasoning. Drizzle with olive oil and toss so everything is evenly coated. Place in the oven for 30 minutes.

3 Remove the roasting tin from the oven, stir and then place the salmon fillets on top of the veg. Sprinkle a pinch of Cajun seasoning over each fillet. Bake for another 12-15 minutes, until the salmon is cooked.
4 Serve with a good squeeze of lemon, if you like.

title: ASPARAGUS FRITTATA
summary: Looking for lunch inspiration? Quick, filling and delicious, my asparagus frittata has a tasty kick of spice. If your family don’t like spice, just leave out the chilli.” - chef Chris Baber
ingredients: 2 tsp Cook with M&S easy chilli
recipe_steps: 1 Preheat the oven to 200°C/ 180°C fan/ gas mark 6

2 Add all the veg and chopped tomatoes to a roasting tin, season with salt and pepper, and then scatter over half the Cook With M&S Cajun seasoning. Drizzle with olive oil and toss so everything is evenly coated. Place in the oven for 30 minutes.

3 Remove the roasting tin from the oven, stir and then place the salmon fillets on top of the veg. Sprinkle a pinch of Cajun seasoning over each fillet. Bake for another 12-15 minutes, until the salmon is cooked.
4 Serve with a good squeeze of lemon, if you like.
